body: LEAD: One of the most enduring symbols of the holiday season is the Christmas tree, and New York City certainly has no shortage of dazzling ones. And this may be the very best time to see them, after Christmas, when the crowds and traffic have thinned. Most will be up through this week. title: Lifestyle: Sunday Outing; Christmas May Be Ove But Trees Still Sparkle

body: LEAD: A retired police officer, working in a Brooklyn jewelry store, was killed yesterday by a robber, the police said. body: LEAD: The New York State Court of Claims yesterday awarded a record $1.93 million to a Brooklyn man who spent six years in state prisons for a murder and robberies he did not commit. body: LEAD: With a little help from some audacious engineers and dedicated landscape architects, New York City is quietly creating a 399-acre, 505-foot-high pyramid of garbage at the Fresh Kills Landfill on Staten Island. title: A Wonder Of Waste Rises on S.I.

body: LEAD: UNTIL spring, most New Yorkers would probably prefer to forget that there even is an outdoors, a place where chill winds nip mercilessly at bundled-up strollers. But for hardy urban explorers, New York is more than just an agglomeration of warm buildings. About one-seventh of the city's 303.7 square miles is parkland, and in it one can hike
title: The Great Outdoors, Within City Limits
